page.title: 11R.E. IN N.TONBRIDGE SCHOOLS
page.content: We sent out questionnaires to 10 schools in the Tonbridge/Hildenborough area.We asked about the schools' religious education and what part religion plays there.On average there are 2 scripture lessons per week in each school;5 schools have scripture exams for pupils.The average school has 4 compulsory assemblies with no voluntary extras.4 schools only (3 Church of England,the other Catholic) follow a particular religion.The pupils of 9 schools involve themselves in religious activities outside the school,and the lives of most pupils are affected by their religion.The assemblies' form varies between one led by by a pupil or group of pupils with hymns,prayers,talks and readings and one led by a visiting vicar,a teacher or class taking weekly turns.
